intro: Eustoma exaltatum var. albiflorum, commonly known as the white lisianthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, spindly stems and clusters of large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is known for its delicate, fragrant blooms that appear in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardens and floral arrangements. Its botanical features make it both ornamental and ecologically valuable in native habitats.
